result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. Arndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both
Shall enroll and successfully complete Thinking for Change or Cognitive Intervention Program

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone selling, manufacturing, delivering or distributing illegal drugs;  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Shall submit a DNA sample.  Shall submit to random drug screens
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges

Probation Intake Order

Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with attorney Charles W Giesen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has reviewed both PSI reports, counsel acknowledge receipt of reports.  Corrections to PSI placed orally on the record by Atty Giesen;  Atty Klomberg has no objections.  Atty Klomberg heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Giesen responds.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

COUNT 1:
w/held sentence - 4 years probation 
6 mos DCJ as COP w/h&t comm. on or before 12/15/15
AODA
no possession of any illegal drug or drug paraphernalia
random drug screens
not to be in presence of anyone selling, manufacturing, delivering or distributing illegal drugs
maintain absolute sobriety
do not enter any taverns or liquor stores whose primary item for sale is alcohol
remain gainfully employed and/or education
court costs
enrolll and successfully complete Thinking for Change or Cognitive Intervention Program
provide DNA sample



COUNT 2:
w/held sentence - 4 years probation - conc. to count 1
conditions of probation same as count 1 -- w/o jail time
Alternative presentence report
courts letter to the parties regarding PSI
from agent
Sentencing hearing at 10-16-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with attorney Charles W Giesen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Def enters NC plea to Ct 1 & 2. Court accepts pleas to Ct 1 & 2 and finds guilty; Ct 3 is DRI. Joint request for PSI. Court orders same; sets Sentencing Hearing. PSI to be completed within 6 weeks. Any private PSI to be submitted 2 weeks prior to sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on July 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on July 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on May 19, 2015 at 08:00 am.
for disclosure of exculpatory information
for disclosure of confidential informants
Telephone scheduling conference on April 21, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Michael L. Arndt appeared by phone means with Attorney Susan Marie Roth. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Charles Giesen appears in court for the def Michael Arndt. Atty Giesen heard, was just retained by def. Atty Roth heard, willing to withdraw. Def heard, agrees w/Atty Roth to withdraw and Atty Giesen to represent. Atty Klomberg does not object, request paperwork to be filed and discovery forwarded to Atty Giesen. Court approves transfer of representation to Atty Geisen.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 17, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 13, 2015 at 12:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Roth indicated that she believes her client is pursuing alternate counsel and asked for a TSC thirty days from now.  The State takes no position as there is no victim.  Defendant is to provide a copy of the Notice of Hearing to his new attorney so he or she is aware of the TSC.  Defendant may call in for the hearing as well.
Status conference on February 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Order on Arraignment

Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:00 am.

9:17 - Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New address given: W117 Cottage Ave, Oconomowoc 53066.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $10,000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
